results.title: Snow safe
results.creator_credit: Jack Creswick and Australian Ski Patrol Association
results.brief_description: A well produced video looking at all aspects of ski and snow safety. Covers appropriate clothing and equipment, selection of equipment, getting proper ski instruction, ski slope courtesy and behaviour, using lifts, ski slope signs, what to do in case of accident or getting lost, care of children, food and hypothermia, and safe tobogganing. Narrated by Debbie Byrne.

results.title: Senior Campus
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, George Cass and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: In panel interviews, staff, students and parents of two schools, Bendigo Senior High and Kurani College, Morwell, discuss issues related to planning, developing and running of a senior campus and a school complex with a senior campus.

results.title: Return to Botany Bay
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, David Ferris and Victoria. Schools Division. Curriculum Branch
results.brief_description: Intersperses 1987 documentary footage of the re-enactment of the voyage of the First Fleet with Trevor Lunn interviewing an Australia Post representative discussing their role in the Bi-centennial re-enactment and production of the commemorative stamp series.

results.title: Gold fever
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, George Cass, TV Ed Productions and Victoria. Schools Division. Curriculum Branch
results.brief_description: They came to get rich quickly and escape poverty in their homelands, but what they found was not always wealth. This program looks at life on the goldfields and discusses some of the problems that the diggers encountered. Sovereign Hill at Ballarat is featured.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jeff Spencer, George Cass, TV Ed Productions and Victoria. Schools Division. Curriculum Branch

results.title: Television violence and children
results.brief_description: Does television violence have an effect on children? This is one of many questions asked of a panel of experts on a subject of concern to parents and teachers. Includes interviews with Dr T Radecky, Chairman of the USA based National Coalition Against Violence. No other credits available.

results.title: Two sides of the river
results.creator_credit: Brian Carson and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: The port of Echuca was once Australia’s largest inland port along the Murray River. This program looks briefly at life on the river in the early days and at the tourist attraction that the river and its boats have become.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Brian Carson and Victoria. Ministry of Education

results.title: Bendigo pottery
results.creator_credit: Brendan Kenworthy, Trevor Lunn and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: This program gives some insight into the process involved in making pottery and shows some of the types of clay used, the preparation, pot throwing and glazing at the Bendigo pottery.

results.title: The Teaching Ambassadors: International Teaching Fellowships
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Ivan Gaal and Victoria. Ministry of Education

video_links.name: The Teaching Ambassadors: International Teaching Fellowships

results.brief_description: Looks at the International Fellowship Scheme which operates in Victoria. Highlights the professional development aspects of the project, the influence visiting participants have on school communities and the input gained by schools upon the return of Victorian recipients. Featured speakers include: Rex Murfett, Susan Gianevsky, Richard Wood, Alex McKnight and Kevin Collins.
